title: Recipes Research Project (DSC 80)
description: Explored how recipe features, like nutrition and reviews, relate to preparation time.

title: Podcast Subtitle Enhancer
description: Wrote code for generating and enhancing subtitles for the PostgresFM podcast, using Deepgram for transcription and ChatGPT for typo and technical term correction.

title: Portfolio (DSC 106)
description: A portfolio website built with HTML, CSS, and JS, showcasing projects, skills, and contact information.

title: Cat Website
description: This project addresses a major modern issue â€” lack of cats, which are extremely beneficial for reducing stress with their presence.

title: Postgres.AI Slack Chatbot
description: LLM-based Slack chatbot built on top of OpenAI GPT-4 API with RAG, capable of running benchmarks, testing SQL, and more.

title: Predicting Restaurant Ratings with Machine Learning | Final project (CSE 158)
description: Worked in a team to analyze Google restaurant reviews to predict ratings using machine learning. We performed exploratory data analysis, feature engineering, and compared models like sentiment analysis and user-item interactions, evaluating their performance with different metrics.

title: Choosing Your Vacation Spot (DSC 106)
description: This is a visualization project, in which I compared the weather patterns of six U.S. cities using heatmaps of sunshine and rainfall, helping to determine the best vacation spots based on seasonal weather trends.

title: The Data Science Experience: Trends, Demographics, and Predictions (DSC 190)
description: This project, I worked with a partner to analyze the Kaggle Data Science Survey to explore tool usage, demographics, and predict salary and age.

title: Deceptive Visualizations (DSC 106)
description: This is a visualization project, in which I created two visualizations, earnest and deceptive, to highlight tactics used in deceptive visuals and demonstrate the potential dangers.

title: Postgres.AI Consultant
description: LLM-based assistant with RAG, capable of running benchmarks, testing SQL, and more, developed for Postgres.AI. This improved version transitioned from Slack to WebUI, supporting additional OpenAI models like GPT-4o-mini, fine-tuned GPT-4o-mini, and Gemini 1.5 Pro.

title: Highschool Hackathon JuniorHack
description: Co-developed a Python desktop app designed to help users learn English, created as part of the JuniorHack high school hackathon. The app features interactive lessons and exercises to enhance language skills.

title: Highschool Hackathon JuniorHack
description: Co-developed a food sharing website using HTML, created during the 2019 JuniorHack high school hackathon. The website facilitates community-driven food sharing, promoting sustainability and reducing waste.
